job_history.work_description: Responsible for all staff, negotiated a new contract to carve out 95% of in-house billing to an off-site medical billing company, liaison between SDHS and 47 vendors, created a comprehensive project plan for total relocation of the practice, cut costs substantially by eliminating unreliable staff and bringing in more motivated, efficient workers.

Responsible for complex projects for the VP of Risk Solutions and SVP of National Consumer Lending, performed as a Project Manager on 3 large compliance-related controls regarding a new database, created reports on data requirements, executed gap analysis, root cause issues, defined project scopes, identified best practices, created swimlanes and timelines in MS Project.

Supervised a staff of 6 medical clerks, 3 doctors, and 1 psychologist, managed all aspects of payroll, created a new system of accountability, reduced the A/R from $1.4 million to $11,000 by personally reconstructing billing procedures, collections enforcement, and small debt write-offs.

Supervised a staff of 25 collectors and 25 administrative assistants, investigated delinquent accounts and provided reasonable solutions for collectors, created and maintained daily reports for cost efficiency of overall collections and for daily income.

Contracted to supervise a special account with J.Crew Clothiers, created/maintained all reports, manifests, bill of ladings, etc. manually via Excel, designed/supervised the creation of a database in Fox Pro that linked to Excel to produce a master list of all items en route to our warehouse from overseas.

Identified opportunities for lowering costs and increasing efficiency in all services in order to maintain all federal grants, worked closely with Decision Support, Medical Records, and several other departments to determine cost, frequency, and reimbursement patterns of identified services.

Created and implemented the WARS database for the Pharmacy Administration Accounts Receivable Department, archived figures for the Accounting Department to review and cooperated with Data Management on a daily basis.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience managing complex projects, including creating project plans, executing gap analysis, and defining project scopes, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Has supervised staff of varying sizes, including medical clerks, doctors, and administrative assistants, showing strong leadership skills.

skills.name: Payroll Management
skills.explanation: Has managed payroll for staff, indicating a solid working proficiency in payroll management.

skills.name: Data Analysis
skills.explanation: Has performed data analysis, created reports, and executed gap analysis, indicating strong proficiency in data analysis.

skills.name: Operations Management
skills.explanation: Has managed all aspects of office operations, including staff supervision, billing procedures, and collections enforcement, indicating strong proficiency in operations management.

skills.name: Microsoft Excel
skills.explanation: Has used Excel extensively for creating reports, manifests, and bill of ladings, and has also used it to create a master list of items en route to a warehouse, indicating strong proficiency in Excel.

skills.name: Database Management
skills.explanation: Has created and maintained databases, including a database in Fox Pro that linked to Excel, indicating a solid working proficiency in database management.

skills.name: Cost Efficiency
skills.explanation: Has identified opportunities for lowering costs and increasing efficiency in services, indicating a solid working proficiency in cost efficiency.

skills.name: Statistics
skills.explanation: Has worked with statistical data, including creating and implementing a database for the Pharmacy Administration Accounts Receivable Department, indicating a solid working proficiency in statistics.
